title: The Annotated and Illustrated Double Helix
description:
The book is in .azw3 (retail quality, taken directly from the Kindle Store and DeDRMed), and it can be opened in Calibre or you can change the extension to .prc or .mobi (by just renaming the file) to read on your Kindle.


Book description:

Published to mark the 50th anniversary of the Nobel Prize for Watson and CrickÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s discovery of the structure of DNA, an annotated and illustrated edition of this classic book gives new insights into the personal relationships between James Watson, Frances Crick, Maurice Wilkins, and Rosalind Franklin, and the making of a scientific revolution. 

In his 1968 memoir, The Double Helix, the brash young scientist James Watson chronicled the drama of the race to identify the structure of DNA, a discovery that would usher in the era of modern molecular biology. Alexander Gann and Jan Witkowski have built upon this gripping narrative, juxtaposing WatsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s racy account with the observations of other protagonists and offering an enhanced perspective on the now legendary story of Watson and CrickÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s discovery. 

Gann and Witkowski have mined many sources, including a trove of newly discovered correspondence belonging to Francis Crick (mislaid some fifty years ago) and the archives of Maurice Wilkins, Linus Pauling, Rosalind Franklin, and Watson and Crick themselves. Also in this edition are WatsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own account of the Nobel Prize award and celebrations, appendixes that include an account of the bookÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s controversial first publication, and a chapter dropped from the original edition, as well as an extraordinary assortment of documents and photographsÃ¢â‚¬â€ many never before published. This wealth of material contributes depth and color to WatsonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s novelistic text and places events in their contemporary scientific and social context. 

After half a century, the implications of the double helix keep rippling outward; the tools of molecular biology have forever transformed the life sciences and medicine. The Annotated and Illustrated Double Helix adds new richness to the account of the momentous events that led the charge.
